Zaradi bolezni si pri hoji pomaga s palico
Lena Dunham živi z ehlers-danlosovim sindromom. Zdravila se je zaradi odvisnosti, odstranili so ji maternico.
06 Nov 2019, 10:33 by T. P.



guliver/cover imagesAvstralska pevka Sia boleha za isto kronično boleznijo kot Dunhamova. FOTO: guliver/cover images



Guliver/getty imagesBolezni navkljub živi svoje sanje. FOTO: gulivier/getty images



instagram»Ne, to ni moj kostum za noč čarovnic,« je priznala Lena Dunham. FOTO: instagram


Staromonda spalna srajca. Mehki copatki. In palica, na katero se je opirala. Paparaci so ujeli Leno Dunham, ki bi se za svojo nič kaj zvezdniško opravo z lahkoto izgovorila na noč čarovnic, ko se v ZDA našemijo. »Lahko bi lagala in dejala, da je to moj kostum. A resnica je, da je takšno življenje s kronično boleznijo. Živim namreč z ehlers-danlosovim sindromom,« je razkrila Lena, ki je za serijo Punce kot prva v filmski zgodovini prejela prestižno nagrado režiserskega ceha za izjemno režijo (Directors Guild Award).


Bolezni navkljub živi svoje sanje. FOTO: gulivier/getty imagesGuliver/getty images

Lena je dolga leta živela z groznimi bolečinami, za katerimi se je skrivala endometrioza in ki se jih je znebila šele pred dvema letoma s kirurško odstranitvijo maternice. A se je tudi v tem skrivala past, saj se je med okrevanjem zasvojila z zdravili proti tesnobnosti. Zasvojenosti ni skrivala, o ehlers-danlosovem sindromu, ki prizadene vezivno tkivo, pa je molčala. »Dolga leta sem se upirala temu, da bi si pri hoji pomagala s palico, ker bi bila videti čudno. Toda odkar se je bolezen razširila, potrebujem več kot oporo prijateljev. Poleg tega bi bilo precej bolj čudno od mojega videza to, da bi cele dneve ostajala doma v postelji.«Dunhamova ni edina, ki je v teh dneh priznala življenje s kronično boleznijo, za katero so značilni nestabilnost sklepov, okvara srčne zaklopke, počasno celjenje ran in hiperelastičnost kože. Prejšnji mesec je življenje s to boleznijo priznala tudi avstralska pevka Sia, podobno pa se je z njo naučila živeti britanska igralka Jameela Jamil. »Ja, ven sem šla oblečena le v spalno srajco, saj sem želela, da mi je pri zdravniku, kamor sem bila namenjena, udobno. A že malo pozneje, še isti dan, sem bila tudi v svojih poslovnih oblačilih. A to je življenje nas žensk, ki živimo s kronično boleznijo. V enem dnevu živimo več življenj,« je še dejala Lena in dodala, da vsemu navkljub živi svoje sanje in dosega zastavljene cilje.

Because of his illness, he helps with his walking stick
Lena Dunham lives with ehlers-danlos syndrome. She was being treated for addiction and her uterus was removed.
06 Nov 2019, 10:33 by T.P.



gulliver / cover imagesAustralian singer Sia suffers from the same chronic illness as Dunham's. PHOTO: gulliver / cover images



Gulliver / getty imagesDiseases despite living your dream. PHOTO: gulivier / getty images



instagram "No, this is not my Halloween costume," Lena Dunham admitted. PHOTO: instagram


Old-fashioned nightgown. Soft shoes. And the stick she relied on. The paparazzi caught up with Lena Dunham, who could easily say goodbye to Halloween when they're in the US. “I could lie and say it was my costume. But the truth is, that kind of life is with a chronic illness. I live with ehlers-danlos syndrome, ”revealed Lena, who received the prestigious Directors Guild Award for the Punca series as the first in film history.


Illnesses nevertheless live out their dreams. PHOTO: gulivier / getty imagesGuliver / getty images

For many years, Lena was in terrible pain, behind which endometriosis was hidden, and which she had gotten rid of only two years ago with surgical removal of her uterus. But there was also a trap in this, as she became addicted to anti-anxiety medication during her recovery. She did not hide her addiction, but remained silent about ehlers-danlos syndrome, which affects the connective tissue. “For many years, I resisted using a walking stick because it would look strange. But since the disease has spread, I need more than a friend's support. In addition, it would be much more strange than my appearance to stay in bed all day. ”Dunham is not the only one who has acknowledged life with a chronic illness these days, characterized by instability of the joints, heart failure, slow healing. wounds and skin hyperelasticity. Last month, Australian singer Sia has acknowledged life with the disease, and British actress Jameela Jamil has learned to live with it. “Yes, I only went out wearing a nightgown, because I wanted to be comfortable with the doctor I was going to. But a little later, the same day, I was in my business clothes. But this is the life of us women living with a chronic illness. We live more lives in one day, ”said Lena, adding that despite all of this, she is living her dreams and achieving her goals.
